How safe do city\u2019s models working l.description: The harrowing experience that Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta went through recently in her own city had many in shudders. Images of a gang of unruly bikers following her app cab, beating up the driver and vandalising the car were splashed all over. The City Of Joy has now started scaring people with its ugly face, especially for those who work around erratic schedules and return home late. It’s time to take stock of the grave situation. Models in the city share their concerns for themselves and people in professions that demand them to work in late-night shifts. ‘it’s not just about women’s safety’ ‘It’s not only women’s safety that I am concerned about. I stood up for the app cab driver. Anybody can face such a situation and need help. So, the police should be prompt. When I approached the police station, I was not told about the Zero FIR facility. I may not be aware but they should have helped me with the information. In such cases, you can lodge a complaint at any police station even if it doesn’t fall under the crime scenario area. I had a friend with me who is a member of the LGBTQIA+ community and he was so scared. After my post went viral, top cops have come forward to help. But this should be the case for everyone. The question remains how come such hooligans are allowed to ride bikes without helmets, scaring people off in the wee hours?’ — Ushoshi Sengupta‘Over the years, I have been commuting back home in groups during the wee hours. But earlier, the safety scene was a little better than now. When I worked some seven years back, I didn’t have the fear of being attacked playing in the back of my mind. Back then, it would still be safe for a woman to be out alone at midnight. But today, it’s really scary for us. Whenever I am driving, I am haunted by this fear of being stopped by rowdy bikers. This is not just a concern for women in the entertainment world. Regular jobbers and young girls out for enjoying a late-night movie or dinner face the same fear. Why can’t they roam around freely?’ — Jessica Gomes‘It’s unthinkable that no one came to help Ushoshi that day. The law and order in the state has been questionable for a long while now. It’s clearly deteriorating day by day. It’s not just about the women but also about people like the app cab drivers, who work late night. They don’t have any strings to pull. It’s great that social media users have come forward to help the cause. If I ever go through such a situation, the first thing that will come to my mind is that I will have to go to the nearest police station for lodging an FIR. But if I don’t receive help, it will be difficult. In the dead of the night, how can the police tell a woman that it should not be this police station but some other? I don’t know where we are heading. I have also faced such negligence but in other cases like losing a phone. We do have random schedules and timings. We can’t help it. Earlier when my dad would want to assist me to work, I would say I can manage. Now, I really think twice. Such cases are not one-offs anymore. I also have to be very careful about what I wear while returning late in the night. It’s scary and annoying at the same time. Kolkata is losing its basic sense of humanity’ — Diti Saha‘I have been working since 2016 and have been in constant fear while returning late in the night. With God’s grace, I have not faced such scary scenarios till now. But I do feel insecure and scared at times. I stay really far away from south Kolkata, where most of my assignments take place. I have to return all the way to Sodepur at night. I completely rely on app cabs. I do send my commuting details to my family to take precaution. But this is all that I can do. I have heard from my senior colleagues that the city used to be safer earlier. Ushoshidi is working since long but the incident happened now. So, we can well imagine. Our safety in the city has become a question mark nowadays’ — Ria Bhattacherjee‘I started modelling 13 years back. The question of safety was there at that time too. But I never faced such fearful events. In our profession, late night is not new but if this is what women have to face then it’s unfortunate. Hats off to Ushoshi! The girl fought against so many unruly men. In our time, all these used to happen in the dark lanes but now it is happening on the main road. That’s really sad. If such situations continue then I really don’t know what will happen. Not only models but there are women from other professions too who work late. So, what is the solution? Should women stop working then? It will help if the police are prompt in lodging the FIR wherever women approach them first. They can decide later under which area the crime scene falls’ — Madhabilata MitraDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bacteria in packaged water in city\u2019.description: KOLKATA: Drinking water sold in 20-litre jars, at prices half that of reputable brands, are under the scanner following the confirmed presence of coliform bacteria in a large number of samples collected from the southern fringes of the city. KMC is already planning a crackdown on unscrupulous units. More than 100 residents of Vidyasagar Colony, Baghajatin and Ramgarh tested positive for Hepatitis A — which spreads from infected food or water — in less than a fortnight, as reported by TOI on May 31. Times ViewNow that the KMC has evidence, it should act against all unscrupulous bottlers who may be putting the citizen’s health at risk. The action needs to be in the form of a sustained campaign.Now, the test results from the KMC laboratory, confirming the presence of the bacteria, have triggered alarm bells far beyond these areas. With packaged drinking water being widely distributed and consumed across the city, there are fears of more cases emerging from other areas. Physician Sanjay Dasgupta, who is treating more than 50 Hepatitis A patients from these localities, said several packaged water brands had cropped up locally, which sell contaminated water. “I am convinced that packaged drinking water has been a major source of contamination,” he said. “Apart from poor quality of production, most city-based manufacturers and traders also ignore the hygiene factor, which leads to health hazards and may cause stomach-related diseases like colitis and jaundice,” said physician Sanjay Dasgupta. Coliform bacteria are organisms that are present in the environment and in the faeces of all warm-blooded animals and humans. These bacteria will not likely cause illness, but their presence in drinking water indicates the presence of disease-causing organisms (pathogens) in the water system. Most pathogens that can contaminate water supplies come from the faeces of humans or animals. Since testing drinking water for all possible pathogens is complex, time-consuming and expensive, a relatively easy and less expensive test is done for coliform bacteria to rule whether the water is safe to drink. Deputy mayor Atin Ghosh, who also looks after KMC’s health department, has directly blamed units selling spurious packaged drinking water for the spread of enteric diseases in Kolkata and called for a crackdown, with help from the enforcement department. “We need to get rid of unscrupulous traders dealing in packaged drinking water. Going by laboratory tests, we have reasons to worry about the samples of packaged drinking water collected from the affected areas,” Ghosh said. Last year, too, during an outbreak in the Jadavpur-Baghajatin belt that claimed two lives and sent hundreds to hospital, fingers had been pointed at suspect packaged drinking water units. Whereas contamination in civic taps or pipelines is easier to detect and control, the spread of illness can become much wider if the contamination source is spurious packed water, as it is distributed in PET bottles and jars. Last May, following the outbreak, KMC’s water department had collected 20-litre packaged water jars from several vendors and dealers in the affected localities. There is another reason for concern. Debasish Mukherjee, the RSP councillor in the affected belt, said: “Unlike water supplied by KMC, which is filtered or boiled before consumption in various households, contaminated packaged drinking water is dangerous because people presume it is safe and consume it directly.” A KMC laboratory analysis of water samples from several packaged water bottles and jars, as well as civic taps in the affected belt, found presence of coliform bacteria in large numbers. This is the second time that water from these localities has been found contaminated. In the days following the initial reports of the Hepatitis A outbreak, around 14 water samples were collected, of which 12 were found to contain coliform bacteria. My Right Of Way: Roads Free Of Creeps At.description: By: Trina Banerjee Working on night shifts has its share of pros and cons. But for women, returning home from office in the middle of the night is a different ball game altogether. Monday night’s incident of a model being harassed in the dead of the night has reinforced my fears. The moment a hooligan gang spots me in the car — there is a security guard with me — they start singing or screaming and try to get close to the car. This is scary. What if they harm me? What if they stop the car and drag me out? How will I save myself? Who can I approach for help? My nervous mind stops working. I feel vulnerable. I remember a couple of such incidents. In the first, my car was waiting at the signal at Esplanade when two bikes stopped beside it. The men kept staring at me while singing some cheap numbers as long as I waited at the signal. I was petrified. I moved to the middle of the rear seat, rolled up the car windows and prayed for a safe ride. But till date, I can’t forget how insecure I felt that night. Another incident I remember was during a festival. My car was stuck at Anwar Shah Road and the road was chock-a-block with revellers. I was seated behind the driver. A little scared, I was about to pull up the window when a guy stuck his head in. His face was right in front of me. Shuddering in fear, I hurried to the other side of the car. Similar incidents have happened multiple times, and its worse during festivals when road romeos become more daring. I feel lucky to be safe. But what about the panic and helplessness I have to encounter? Every time I face such an incident, the first thing I look for is the nearest police station. I also try to remember if any of my friends or colleagues lives nearby so that I can call for help. What if the traffic cop on duty doesn’t help me? What will be the last resort? Jumping out of the car and running for my life? It makes me angry that women have to face such experiences every other night. Why must we go through all this? Why can’t I feel safe while driving back home at night? Why can’t I enjoy the rain on my way back, not bothering about how many bikes or cars are there on the road? I don’t have any answer. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kol to be cloudy today, monsoon may hit.description: KOLKATA: A thunderstorm struck Kolkata for the second consecutive day on Wednesday, leading to a spell of heavy shower. It was triggered by a low pressure and a cyclonic circulation and could be followed by more rain on Thursday. Monsoon could hit south Bengal on Friday, said the Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC). Kolkata recorded a maximum temperature of 37.6°C on Wednesday. Wednesday’s thunderstorm was accompanied by gusty winds that reached a maximum speed of 48kmph. But it didn’t last a minute to qualify as a squall. The day temperature is set to drop on Thursday and the city could remain cloudy. “Low pressure over north Bay of Bengal and a cyclonic circulation that has formed near Jharkhand have started generating clouds. These could float into Kolkata and lead to moderate rain on Thursday. More showers are expected as the low pressure intensifies and we expect monsoon to set in by Friday,” said RMC director GK Das. On Wednesday, several south Bengal districts, including Midnapore, Jhargram, Hooghly and Burdwan, received heavy showers. Weathermen said the rain could gradually intensify across the rest of south Bengal over the next two-three days. “Since the relevant currents have started reviving, we expect the showers to pave the way for monsoon,” Das added. Cyclone Vayu that hit the Gujarat coast earlier this month had stalled the monsoon currents. The Bay branch of the monsoon, which hits south Bengal by the second week of June, was affected. Instead of June 1, which was the scheduled date for its arrival in Kerala, monsoon reached the southern Bengal on June 8. The monsoon arms, including the Bay branch, remained inactive till Vayu passed by. The delay in the onset of monsoon left south Bengal hot and humid. While the maximum temperature in coastal districts remained two-three degrees above normal, a heat-wave warning was sounded for Purulia, Bankura, Birbhum, West Midnapore and Jhargram. 40-year-old man \u2018flashes\u2019 at w.description: KOLKATA: A 28-year-old woman filed an FIR stating she was being allegedly stalked by a 40-year-old man over a period of time and when she was on her way home on Monday, the accused allegedly flashed and masturbated in front of her. Police sources said the woman, who is married and resides in the Ultadanga area, claimed Pintu has been expressing interest in her over a period of time. “As time passed, Pintu became more and more desperate, stopping her on the road despite repeated rebuffs and asked to stay away. The FIR stated, the accused masturbated in front of the complaint thereby outraging her modesty. Cops said they received the complaint on Monday and promptly turned it in to an FIR. “A case has been registered under IPC sections 354D (outrage of modesty, which includes whoever follows a woman and contacts, or attempts to contact such woman to foster personal interaction repeatedly despite a clear indication of disinterest by such woman) and 509 (word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman),” said an investigating officer. Sources said the woman will soon get her statement recorded by a magistrate as per the set legal procedures and summon the accused for questioning. The app-cab driver, who was arrested for allegedly masturbating while driving a woman passenger is out on bail, having been charged with committing unwelcome sexual overtures. With several incidents reported from Delhi and Kolkata in just two years it has got people wondering if this is a growing menace and what legal provisions are there to counter it. But such cases rarely get reported to police. “We are encouraging more people to report such incidents,” said an officer at Lalbazar. Cops are presently scanning the CCTV footage from in around the area. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

TMC next-gen lauds \u2018statesman\u2019.description: KOLKATA: These medics took to social media or hit the streets to express their solidarity with the protesting doctors at NRS Hospital a week ago. Shabba Hakim, mayor Firhad Hakim’s daughter, Baidyanath Ghosh Dastidar, MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar’s son, and Abesh Banerjee, chief minister Mamata Banerjee’s nephew, were also among the first to laud her for her “statesmanship” to resolve the crisis “transparently” that would help Bengal’s healthcare in the long run. Biadyanath, in a detailed post after the cease-work was called off, mentioned, “Unlike Gujarat or Tamil Nadu, ESMA was not needed. Unlike Jyoti Basu, the doctors were not lathicharged. The crisis was resolved by dialogue, compassion, wise leadership and a bit of momota (compassion) on the part of the government.” He wrote, “At the end of the day, the sick patients of West Bengal won. I am immensely proud of the interns, house-staff and PGTs... None raised personal demands such as salary, perks or holidays. I hope the people understand that doctors genuinely care for patients and don’t run after money.” He thanked the chief minister for her statesmanship. “I thank her for statesmanship. This is the first instance in the history of Independent India that a CM has addressed the issues of doctors on live camera.” Shabba wrote on social media, “Considering BJP has appointed a person known to have physically assaulted doctors like Ananth Kumar Hedge as a Minister, their support during our protest was about embarrassing TMC and Mamata Banerjee. I am proud of doctors from all over India for not falling for their hypocrisy and keeping our movement apolitical.” She also endorsed a post which said, “I don’t think Doctors won today. It is the Health System of Bengal that won! And we all fought for it!” To a post that her initial stand on the issue had an impact on the movement, she said, “All I did was speak from the heart. It was about me being a doctor and not whom I am related to. Though I always maintain that it’s my parents who taught me to stand up for what is right.” She said, “I am proud to be a doctor and a Bengali today.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kolkata Metro suicide disrupts peak-hour.description: KOLKATA: Evening peak-hour Metro services were severely hit on Tuesday after a middle-aged man committed suicide at Rabindra Sadan station around 5.29pm. According to a Metro Railway official, the man jumped from the edge of the platform just as a Kavi Subhash-bound train was entering the station. The motorman applied the emergency brakes, but a few coaches had passed over him by the time the train stopped. Passengers were evacuated at Rabindra Sadan. Metro staffers looked under the rake to check for any sign of life. When they couldn’t spot any movement, the train was reversed and power to the third rail was turned off. As a result, all services were suspended between the Central and Mahanayak Uttam Kumar stations. Truncated services ran in both directions between Central and Noapara stations and Mahanayak Uttam Kumar and Kavi Subhash stations. Tuesday’s rain worsened matters as there were very few vehicles on the streets. Most preferred to wait inside the stations till services resumed at 6.31pm. Md Ali Park Puja may not get entire area.description: KOLKATA: The Durga Puja at Md Ali Park will not be able to utilize the full space because of safety reasons. The Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) is still renovating the park after the century-old brick-built underground water reservoir had collapsed on March 31. The civic authorities have been working to restore the park as much as possible in the three and a half months till the Pujas. Mayor Firhad Hakim, who went to inspect Md Ali Park on Wednesday, said, “The water tank, which is in poor condition, is necessary for supplying water to a large area. The Md Ali Park Durga Puja draws lakhs of visitors and their safety is the first priority. The Puja will be organized, but just how much of the park area can be used will be decided as per the suggestions of JU experts. We will decide on this issue in a week’s time,” Hakim said. The underground reservoir, which supplies water to a large area of Burrabazar and central Kolkata, has a capacity of 3 million gallons. Officials of the civic water supply department said contractors have been engaged to remove the top soil of the park to lessen the load on the reservoir. This was done following preliminary tests by civic engineers and JU experts. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

India-Singapore pact for green protectio.description: KOLKATA: The Agri-Horticultural Society of India (AHSI) will collaborate with Singapore Botanical Gardens (SBG) to set up shared objectives for environmental protection and sustainable development. ASHI and SBG have signed a memorandum of understanding to extend mutual cooperation to foster capacity building and training in horticulture through knowledge sharing on management and appreciation of the living heritage. The organizations will work together on public interpretation and educational outreach activities, and skill development for staff will be facilitated through exchange programmes. AHSI and SBG will also collaborate on implementing horticulture projects of mutual interest. SBG, a unit of the National Parks Board, is the only tropical garden to be honoured as a Unesco World Heritage Site. “It has become crucial for institutions dedicated towards safeguarding our environmental heritage to come together and share knowledge to achieve a common goal. We at AHSI are excited about our partnership with SBG,” said ASHI president Sunil Kanoria. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Howrah-Delhi by train in 12 hours?.description: NEW DELHI: In the next four years, you can hope to reach Delhi from Howrah in just 12 hours boarding a superfast train. Similarly, the journey from Mumbai to Delhi could be completed in just 10 hours. The railways has set the target to increase the maximum speed of trains on these routes to 160 kmph to cut down the travel time between the national capital and financial capital by five hours and save five-and-half-hours’ journey time between Delhi and Kolkata. The fastest trains now (Rajdhani) can run at a maximum speed of 130 kmph. This is among the clutch of proposals that the railways has finalised as a part of its 100-day agenda under the second edition of the Narendra Modi government. The railways estimates spending of about Rs 13,500 crore in shoring up the national transporter’s infrastructure over the next four years. According to a circular issued by Railway Board chairman V K Yadav, enhancing track infrastructure on these two busy routes is necessary as they account for nearly 30% of passenger and 20% of total freight traffic on the rail network. Yadav has instructed officials to initiate immediate action to start implementing the plans by August 31 and the ministry has sent the proposals to the PMO. Sources said Yadav on Wednesday shared the details of the targets including the plan to bring in private players to run passenger trains on select routes at a meeting of Group of Secretaries on infrastructure. TOI on Wednesday reported the move by railways to open up the passenger segment for private entities and the plan to launch a mega campaign to pursue people to “give up” the concessions that they can avail while buying tickets. The railways has also proposed to obtain all approvals in the next 100 days to eliminate 2,568 level crossings on Golden Quadrilateral and diagonals with rail over bridges and rail under bridges. It has estimated spending of about Rs 50,000 crore in the next four years for this and the entire funding will come from Centre. This will be level two government intervention to do away with level crossing. Earlier, the government had eliminated “unmanned level crossings” either with ROBs/ RUBs or by deploying people after installing gates. Constructing of ROBs and RUBs will ensure seamless traffic movement across the tracks. Other targets include obtaining Cabinet approval for a digital corridor for railways with provision of 10 MHz spectrum in 700 MHz frequency band for railways which will enable it to increase trains’ carrying capacity due to increase speed potential, improve operation during fogs and improved security. Other proposals include providing Wi-Fi at all 6,485 railway stations, starting a pilot for an advanced signalling system, jump-starting process redevelopment of 50 railway stations and restructuring of the Railway Board. Multi-level checks for membership drive.description: Kolkata: The West Bengal BJP, which is planning to put up multi-level filters for ‘active party membership’, will proceed cautiously during the month-long membership drive. While it is likely to add 25,000 active members in Bengal this year, it has decided to allow the proposals to go through a multi-level screening process from the mandal level. Taking a leaf out of the controversies over a few recent inductions, including Labhpur legislator Monirul Islam, BJP has decided to first scrutinise their background. PM Narendra Modi has also started following Twitter handles of general secretary-level state leaders. In his tweet on Wednesday, BJP Bengal minder Kailash Vijayvargiya pointed to enhanced responsibility. Former Madhya Pradesh CM and special membership drive convener Shivraj Singh Chouhan, who has sent a note to the state leaders, has also asked booth-level workers to verify even those who opt for primary membership. BJP’s support base in Bengal has jumped in the past few months. “The total number of primary members has crossed 42 lakh. Primary membership is open to everybody,” Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh said. “There is a spurt in membership, especially in the districts, where the party bagged Lok Sabha seats. But that might also lead to indiscriminate recruitment, which will hurt the party in the long run,” said a state BJP leader. While there will be no bar on primary membership, elevation to active membership will require scrutiny. “A primary member is eligible to be an active member after two years. But that does not automatically transform into active member status. Only an active member is eligible to hold posts in the organisation,” said Sayantan Basu, state general secretary. On Wednesday, BJP joint general secretary (organisation) Shiv Prakash asked state leaders to go slow on indu-cting active members. “There are around 60,000 active members in about 1,000 mandals,” said a state BJP leader. “Although we are focussing on states like Bengal, we will restrict the number of new active members to 25,000,” said a BJP leader. After the membership drive till August 10, the process of organisational elections will start at the booth level. The process is likely to be over by end-2019 with some changes in the state party leadership. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nMusical Event in Kolkata\n.description: The event turned out to be one starry affair with Babul Supriyo, Prosenjit Chatterjee and Vinod Rathod coming together for a cultural evening, organized by Tochan Ghosh, at a city theatre recently .  The programme also saw the who's who of Tollywood in attendance. Babul set the mood for the evening with songs like Tumi robe nirobe, Sedino akashe chilo koto tara and more.He was joined by Rituparna Sengupta, who also crooned a few lines. Usha Uthup added zing to the show with her hit number Uri uri baba. “It's been a long association with Tochonda.Several artistes in Tollywood have got recognition because of him,“ Usha said. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

After delivering for Cong on his turf, A.description: Kolkata: “Yoddha” Adhir Chowdhury, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi called him the other day, won’t be the same maverick leader who hit headlines with his “chor machaye shor” speech in Parliament against Mamata Banerjee’s party ahead of the 2019 Lok Sabha polls and fought single-handedly against BJP and Trinamool from Behrampore with tacit support of the Left. Chowdhury now has to do tightrope walking in Parliament in a bid to take along all opposition parties, including Trinamool, against the BJP-led NDA government under the strict supervision of Congress seniors Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi. According to senior parliamentarians, Chowdhury will have to focus on opposition consensus on the House floor that won’t always match with the anti-BJP, anti-Trinamool mandate he got from Behrampore. Chowdhury began his day in Parliament on Wednesday with the innocuous “kochuri and khichri” speech while giving thanks to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, leaving his admirers hoping that he might regain his punch in future. Leader of opposition in West Bengal assembly Abdul Mannan, however, believes Chowdhury will be able to turn this apparent disadvantage into an advantage for Congress in the state. “Adhir is a mass leader after ABA Ghani Khan Chowdhury and Priya Ranjan Dasmunshi. People trust him. He is also aware of the tough task ahead, which is why he had proposed Rahul Gandhi’s name as CLP leader. But I am happy Congress high command has reposed faith in him. It has come as a moral boost to Congress workers in Bengal when Trinamool is facing desertions,” Mannan said. Chowdhury’s elevation in Congress, nine months after his removal as West Bengal Pradesh Congress president in September 2018, reaffirms the party’s confidence in him despite his access to the PM and his proximity to UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath. His loyalist and Congress deputy leader in Bengal assembly, Manoj Chakrabarty, believes that the new feather in Chowdhury’s cap will help the party’s rejuvenation, particularly in Murshidabad where the ruling Trinamool had taken control of civic bodies through poaching Congress MLAs and councillors. But how far Chowdhury can assert himself in going the whole hog against Trinamool is the question. Trinamool chief Mamata Banerjee has excellent rapport with Sonia, who will be calling the shots inside and outside Parliament. Asked if such an arrangement would compromise Chowdhury’s stance against Trinamool, Chakrabarty said: “I think Adhir-da can tide over the problem, given his stature, when the party high command has recognised his contribution. He has got a pat on the back from the PM as well.” State Congress president Somen Mitra is happy with the way the party high command has given importance to Bengal. “Pranab Mukherjee was the leader of the House when the party was in power. Adhir has been made the leader when the party is in opposition. It shows Congress seniors are banking on Bengal,” Mitra said. The PCC president, however, saw no difficulty in Chowdhury doing floor coordination with opposition parties inside Parliament and pursuing the party line outside. “Chowdhury implemented the party line. Our party’s stance against BJP and Trinamool hasn’t changed. I believe people in Bengal are mature enough to distinguish between the party’s floor coordination and its political strategy. We are still open to building movements with the Left in Bengal,” Mitra said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

La Marts move faces challenge.description: KOLKATA: A day after Bishop Paritosh Canning re-installed Supriyo Dhar as the secretary of the La Martiniere schools, four members of the board of governors challenged the decision, calling it unlawful and demanding a retraction. Shane Calvert, the Anglo-Indian MLA, who held the position after Dhar had resigned in October last year, was removed on Monday. Anil Mukherjee, COO of Tolly Club, Suchitra Guha, former Tata Steel HR head, Gerry Arathoon, chief of the Council of Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) and Anjali Das, principal of United Missionary School, are the four members who have written to the Bishop, voicing their dissent. Bishop reinstates ex-secretary of La Martiniere SchoolsThe letters state that Calvert was appointed by the consent of all the members of the La Martiniere Board and his removal is against the constitution of the school. The letter by Mukherjee (in possession of TOI) states that it is not the Bishop, but the high court, that is the guardian of the school and the Bishop, by dint of being an ex-officio member, cannot take unilateral decisions. “No reason has been cited for his removal. We challenge this,” said an irate Mukherjee. “The two ex-officio governors, in the light of the orders of the High Court, do not have any power more than the nominated and elected governors. The action taken by the ex-officio governor (read bishop) is as such clearly wrongful.” Guha said that the contents of all the letters are more or less the same. “How can the bishop remove a secretary and bring back someone who had resigned citing his own reasons? I have demanded an explanation,” she said. The four members have demanded that an immediate meeting be convened of all the board members and the matter of removal of Calvert and bringing back Dhar be debated there. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

None blamed us but it pained us to see p.description: KOLKATA: Bibi Bagan Lane in Tangra, the neighburhood from where an elderly person was taken to NRS Hospital last week and his death led to the weeklong agitation, heaved a collective sigh of relief as the doctor-administration impasse ended on Monday. Normality returning to government hospitals made the family of the deceased feel less guilty for something they never wanted to happen. But a sense of fear hung heavy in the air as the youngsters seemed scared of another round of police action, after five from the area were picked up for assault on doctors.  “Allah insaaf karega. Par logon ki pareshaani kam hui (Allah will do justice. But people are now spared the trouble),” said Shamma Khatun, daughter of the deceased, Md Syed (75). “We could not even mourn our father properly as the situation went out of control. Worse was the suffering of thousands of people, including many from our locality, who could not get treatment at government hospitals. That pained us the most. None of them in this locality has the means to get treatment at private nursing homes.” Peering out of a small room in the congested lane, Khatun tried to hide her tears. “My younger brother, Md Shabir, is yet to get over the shock of losing our father. He leaves home early in the morning and roams around aimlessly. At times, his friends find him weeping beside our father’s grave,” she said. “None in the locality blamed us for what followed, but we feel it should not have happened.” Her elder brother, Md Israel, a maulana at a nearby mosque, sat inside a room, talking over phone. “We can pray for those who are in pain. What else can we do?” she said. As Khatun spoke, a few neighbours gathered around. They recounted the harassment people from the neighbourhood had to go through, seeking treatment in the past week. Md Shauqat’s daughter-in-law was in an advanced stage of pregnancy and was under the treatment of a doctor at NRS Hospital. “But they refused her admission. Turned away by NRS, we took her to CNMCH but even there, the doctors were on strike,” Shauqat recounted. After much coaxing, the woman was admitted to CNMCH, where she delivered a baby the next day. “The doctors were good to us and there is nothing we can complain about. But we had to pursue them a lot to get her admitted,” Shauqat said. A group of men, who had just returned from the funeral services of a neighbour, sat quietly. The youngsters in the neighbourhood are apprehensive of police action. “Some of the youths went live on Facebook after the rampage. They are scared that they would be identified. We fear another action by the cops after the dust settles down,” a local said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Govt hosps get nodal officers to coordin.description: KOLKATA: The state government has assigned five nodal officers —all senior bureaucrats—to each for the five government medical colleges in the city to coordinate with the hospital administration and police. The nodal officers from Swathya Bhawan will work in tandem with the hospital administrations and the police to implement security measures at these state-run hospitals. Apart from security aspect, the nodal officers will also look after other issues, particularly that of infrastructure, pertaining to respective hospitals. Apart from the five medical colleges and hospitals of the city, the other teaching hospitals in the districts, too, have been given nodal officers from Swasthya Bhawan. While the police will look into the access control at all gates, no illegal parking will be allowed near the hospitals. Swasthya Bhawan, the state health headquarters, on Wednesday also issued an order, giving the medical superintendent-and-vice principal (MSVP) at each hospital the authority to lodge a police complaint in case of vandalism or assault on doctors. A report also has to be sent to the state health department. Two days after chief minister Mamata Banerjee assured junior doctors of effective security measures, state health secretary Rajiva Sinha on Wednesday presided over a meeting with the newly appointed nodal officers, principals and MSVPs of the five government medical colleges in the city and the police nodal officer, DCP (Combat) Colonel Nevendera Singh Paul. Paul’s combat force will train the security personnel at the hospitals on how to tackle mobs. Confirming the meeting, Sinha said, “The suggestions made at the CM meet were followed up during the meeting on Wednesday.” A joint team from the health department and Kolkata Police will start visiting hospitals for security audit from Monday. The team is expected to find out security loopholes at the establishments, such as lapse in access control, and look for room for improvement by checking if more space can be created in the emergency wards, better security can be implemented, more CCTV cameras can installed and if there is a need for augmentation in the existing private security services. Once the audit is completed, the joint team will put in its recommendations. The ground work for the security audit will start from Thursday. “According to the recommendations by the security audit team, an SOP will be prepared and recommended,” a senior officer, who was in the meeting, said. According to the police top brass at Lalbazar, officers have decided to start mapping zones and past incidents to pinpoint certain areas and similar incidents that had led to assaults on doctors in the past. In addition, now that the CCTV footages will be available with the local DCP office, outpost and the local police station, senior officers will use a special app to track the grabs. Police sources said that they would also store the CCTV images from the emergency wards for longer in case they needed to be investigated. In addition, local police will work with the Special Branch, the Anti-Rowdy Squad and the local police stations to assess the local groups or patients’ families that can pose danger. “We are trying to create a separate portal and a unique email ID, where both doctors and patients can raise their respective security issues. In addition, just like in CNMC, NRS and SSKM hospitals right now, we will have panic buttons at other establishments too. There are a few limited ones at NRS, where the number will be increased,” an officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Calcutta HC to hear MP wife\u2019s case.description: Kolkata: The Customs department on Wednesday informed the Calcutta High Court that it was well within its “statutory rights” to issue summons to MP Abhishek Banerjee’s wife Rujira Naroola and her companion Meneka Gambhir. The HC will hear the case on July 22; it directed Customs not to summon them till July 31. Naroola had earlier moved the HC against the Customs summons; Gambhir had filed a writ petition against it. Both cases came up for hearing on Wednesday. In his affidavit to the HC, M G Thamizh Valavam, commissioner (RI & I) Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, alleged that the duo who arrived on Thai flight TG 313 refused to show their passports and three of their seven baggage items were found to contain jewellery during baggage scan. The Customs further alleged that the duo refused to speak when asked about it. When Customs officers wanted to open and check the contents, they were met with stiff resistance and threatened with “dire consequences”, the affidavit alleged and further claimed both had refused to comply with directives. The Customs further alleged that policemen from NSCBI airport police station not only asked it to release both passengers but also entered the airport’s sanitised zone that was exclusively under the department’s purview. The consuls appearing for Customs, additional solicitor general Aman Mallick and lawyer Bhaskar Prasad Banerjee, argued that intentional obstruction to an on-duty Customs officer in this zone is a punishable offence. The HC said it would hear the case again on July 22. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Kolkata: Baggage loaders\u2019 stir dela.description: KOLKATA: Three IndiGo Airlines flights scheduled for takeoff between 3.15pm and 4pm were delayed by at least 15 minutes each following a flash protest by outsourced baggage loaders. Senior airlines officials intervened to control the situation. Sources said the incident had served a warning and the airline was keen to address the issue. Employees who load passenger bags on aircraft before departure and unloads them on arrival at Kolkata airport went on a flash ceasework the proposed pay restruturing being carried out by the airline. While IndiGo outsourced services like loaders to agencies like JP Ground Handling in Kolkata, it has now set up a subsidiary, Agile Aviation, that is taking over the contractual staff on its payroll. "The migration of the employees to IndiGo payroll has to be completed by June 30. When they learnt about the basic salary component on Tuesday, they mistook it for the entire salary and agitated. We have assured them that their salary will actually be more than before," said an airline official. The airline is planning to undertake a class to explain the salary structure to the employees. It also plans to increase the strength of loaders in Kolkata from 800 at present to 1,000-1,100. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Model Ushoshi Sengupta harassed by bike-.description: KOLKATA: Model-turned-actor Ushoshi Sengupta was allegedly chased and harassed by a gang of bikers twice on Monday night while returning home from work in an app-based cab, police said. Seven persons have been arrested in connection with the incident that took place around 11.40pm on Monday, they said. Sengupta, 30, said she was returning home along with a colleague in an app-based cab, which was hit by a few bike-borne youths who dragged the driver out and roughed him up. The model claimed that she had sought help from officers of Maidan police station in the heart of the city, and later went to Charu Market police station in south Kolkata. On both occasions, she was allegedly told that the incident did not happen in their jurisdiction. The Kolkata Police on Tuesday said it has also initiated an inquiry into the alleged non-registration of FIR. "A few boys on a bike without any helmet hit our cab at Exide intersection and Jawaharlal Road crossing... Around 15 boys appeared from nowhere and dragged the driver out, started beating him up. This is when I stepped out and started shouting, calling the police and simultaneously started taking a video of the entire incident," she said. She claimed that officers of the Maidan police station, within 50 metres of the spot, initially did not come for help despite her repeated requests. She was told that the crossing falls under the jurisdiction of Bhawanipore police station. "It was only when I broke down and pleaded that the driver would get killed that the officers responded. But the boys pushed the police officers and fled," she said. After about 10-15 minutes, two officers came from Bhawanipore police station but as it was past midnight by then, Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning. Accordingly, she requested the driver to drop her colleague and her at their homes. The ordeal continued as six boys on three bikes reappeared and started following the cab near the Lake Gardens area in south Kolkata. "They stopped my car, threw stones and dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. My colleague jumped out out of fear and I started shouting to attract some locals' attention there. "I managed to telephone my dad and my sister at my residence in the next lane when they escaped," Sengupta said. The actor also alleged that officers at the nearby Charu Market Police Station refused to take any complaint and advised her to, instead, approach the Bhawanipore Police Station. "After raising a lot of questions, the officer took my complaint but refused to take the complaint of the driver," she said in a Facebook post, recounting the incident. "We have taken this incident very seriously and seven persons have been arrested so far. On the order of the Commissioner of Police, Kolkata, an inquiry regarding the non-registration of FIR has been initiated into this incident, at a very senior level," the Kolkata Police wrote on its Twitter handle. The arrests were made on the basis of video grabs provided by Sengupta and CCTV footages. When contacted, a senior police officer said, "Those arrested seem to be locals who have been violating traffic rules for quite some time. We are hopeful of nabbing the others from the CCTV footages of the surrounding areas." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kolkata: AHSI partners Singapore Botanic.description: KOLKATA: Agri-Horticultural Society of India (AHSI), one of the oldest Botanical Gardens in Asia, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Singapore Botanical Gardens, a unit of The National Parks Board, Singapore, to work together on shared set of objectives for environmental protection and sustainable development. Founded in 1820 by Rev. Dr. William Carey, with the objective of developing and promoting agriculture & horticulture in India, and is celebrating its bicentennial this year. Under this partnership both parties will extend mutual cooperation to foster capacity building and training in horticulture, through knowledge sharing on management and appreciation of the living heritage. The organisations will work together on public interpretation and educational outreach activities. Skill development for staff will be facilitated through exchange programmes, and invitations to relevant horticulture shows, conferences and workshops organised by either institution. AHSI and Singapore Botanical Gardens will also collaborate towards implementing joint horticulture projects of mutual interest. Commenting on this occasion, Sunil Kanoria, President, AHSI, said, "Climate change and environmental issues are some of the most serious concerns at present. It has therefore become extremely crucial for institutions which are dedicated towards the cause of safeguarding our environmental heritage to come together and share knowledge to achieve this common goal. We at AHSI are excited about our partnership with Singapore Botanical Gardens. It is not only one of the best park attractions in Asia, but it is also the only tropical garden to be honoured as a UNESCO World Heritage Site." Founded in 1959, Singapore Botanical Gardens showcases the best and most spectacular of tropical flora set in stunning verdant landscape. The gardens possess an array of botanical and horticultural attractions with a rich history and a wonderful plant collection of worldwide significance. Complementing these unique resources are sensitive developments and entertainment events providing visitors educational and recreational facilities amidst the wonders of nature. The gardens is also an important centre for tropical botanical and horticultural research, education and conservation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two drug dealers arrested in Kolkata.description: KOLKATA: Two drug dealers were arrested with 275 grams of brown sugar here, a Kolkata Police officer said on Wednesday. "Two drug dealers, Sk.A. Latifuddin (37), and Sk. Raja (47), were arrested from 8A Royd Street at around 11.55 p.m. on Tuesday," Joint Commissioner of Kolkata Police Praveen Tripathi said. "They were involved in selling the drugs to youngsters and club-goers in the city." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Ex-village head held after CM\u2019s bri.description: Malda: The first effect of chief minister Mamata Banerjee’s warning against taking cut money was felt on Wednesday when a former Trinamool panchayat pradhan was arrested in Malda’s Ratua. Sukesh Jadab, a former pradhan of Mahanandatola gram panchayat, is accused of embezzling funds from Mission Nirmal Bangla and the 100 days work scheme under National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (NREGA). While Trinamool welcomed the action, Jadab alleged his arrest was a conspiracy. The CM had on Tuesday warned her party workers against indulging in corruption. Jadab was produced in the subdivisional court and remanded in police custody for seven days. On his way to court, Jadab said: “I am the victim of a political conspiracy.” Back in 2013, Jadab had become pradhan as a Congress candidate. In November 2017, Ratua I BDO Arjun Pal lodged a complaint accusing Jadab of misappropriating more than Rs 1 crore from NREGS and Nirmal Bangla schemes. It was alleged that while records showed 2,600 toilets were built under Nirmal Bangla scheme, these didn’t exist on the ground. Before the 2018 panchayat election, Jadab defected to Trinamool. A police probe launched following the BDO’s complaint was then allegedly hushed up. Jadab, however, lost the 2018 local polls but continued to work as a local Trinamool leader. Following Trinamool candidate Mausam Noor’s loss in the Lok Sabha elections, Bengal’s ruling party became desperate to improve its image. Jadab was arrested from his house soon after. “The ex-pradhan was arrested in connection with misappropriation of funds allocated for toilet construction under Mission Nirmal Bangla,” Malda SP Alok Rajoria said. “He was charged under sections 406,409, 420,506 and 120B IPC.” Masuam Noor said: “We welcome such action. None can be pardoned after misappropriating public money. It is a message to all to make our image clean and transparent.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ramdas Athawale.description: NEW DELHI: Union minister and Republican Party of India leader Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday left members of the Lok Sabha, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in peels of laughter with his witty remarks, some aimed at Congress president Rahul Gandhi. In his congratulatory remarks after the unanimous election of Om Birla as Lok Sabha Speaker, Athawale, who has a knack for spontaneous humour, said he is happy that Rahul got a chance to sit in Lok Sabha though as an opposition member. While Rahul won from Wayanad in Kerala, he lost the Gandhi stronghold of Amethi in Uttar Pradesh to Smriti Irani. #WATCH:Ramdas Athawale in Lok Sabha says,"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon… https://t.co/cRPL9IbuWV— ANI (@ANI) 1560939466000"Rahul ji aapko wahan baithne ka mauka mila isiliye aapko badhai deta hoon. Jab apki satta thi tab main aapke saath tha. Chunav ke pehle mujhe Congress wale bol rahe the idhar aao. Maine hawa ka rukh dekha ki woh Modi ji ki taraf ja rahi hai (I congratulate you on getting an opportunity to sit there (in the Opposition benches). I was with the UPA when it was in power. Congress leaders asked me to join them again ahead of elections. But I saw which way the wind was blowing and decided to remain with NDA," he said. Rahul and Sonia took his remarks sportingly and were seen smiling. When the RPI leader was speaking, Modi was seen laughing on more than two occasions. "Now, our government will run for five years, and for another five years ... Modi sahib will continue to do the good work. We will not let you come this side (treasury benches) so easily," Athawale said, amid thumping of desks by NDA members.
